---
title: "Register models in the inventory"
date: last-modified
---

To be able to document models using ValidMind's model documentation and validation features, you need to register them in the model inventory first.

## Prerequisites

- You are the model owner
- You hold the `Developer` role^1^ 

::: {.column-margin}
**Learn more:**

^1^ [Users (Supported roles)](/guide/configuration/onboarding-users.qmd#supported-roles)

|   [Manage users (User roles)](/guide/configuration/manage-users.qmd#user-roles)
:::

## Steps

1. Log in to the {{< var vm_login >}}.

2. Click **Model Inventory** in the left sidebar. 
<!--- **Need screenshot** --->
   
3. Click **Register new model**.
   
4. Fill in the required information on the registration form:

   - Provide a model name
   - Select the relevant business unit
   - Select the relevant model methodology being used
   - Select the relevant model use case
   - Provide a purpose statement to explain what the model will be used for
   - Select the preliminary risk tier for the model
   - If the model is a vendor model, toggle **Is Vendor Model** and provide the vendor name.

::: {.callout}
[Learn more about vendor models](/about/glossary/glossary.qmd#vendor-model).
:::

5. Click **Register new model** to create a new entry in the model inventory.

   You can now access the model details from the **Model Inventory** page.
